intro: Brandonia, commonly known as the golden star, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Proteaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in diverse habitats such as fynbos vegetation. The plants are characterized by their striking, showy flowers that range in color from yellow to orange, often with a distinctive star-shaped appearance. Brandonia species are typically shrubs or small trees, featuring woody stems and lance-shaped leaves. They play an important ecological role in their native environments, supporting various pollinators and contributing to biodiversity.
